definition: the right way
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: Help things along by having a plan or a meeting.
sentences.chinese: 通过制定计划或展闭会议来襄助事走上正路。

sentences.english: Pharaoh led his people astray instead of leading them aright.
sentences.chinese: 法老把他的百姓领入歧途，他未将他们引入正路。

sentences.english: And I will teach you the way that is good and right.
sentences.chinese: 我必以善道正路指教你们。

sentences.english: Train up a child in the way he should go.
sentences.chinese: 孩子初学步，教他走正路。

sentences.english: Harsh correction is for him who forsakes the way.
sentences.chinese: 舍弃正路的人，必遭受严厉管教。

sentences.english: After going straight for a bit, he will return to petty thieving.
sentences.chinese: 正路走不了多远就又恢复偷摸的恶习。

sentences.english: North Korea could earn far more by going straight.
sentences.chinese: 如果朝鲜走正路，它可以赚到多得多的财富。

sentences.english: We got mixed up in our directions, took the wrong road, and drove many miles out of our way.
sentences.chinese: 我们搞错方向上错了路，结果绕开正路开了许多英里。

sentences.english: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
sentences.chinese: 有一条路，人以为是正路，走到尽头却是死亡之路。

sentences.english: She strayed from the road and got lost.
There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
sentences.chinese: 有一条路，人以为的正路，走到尽头却是死亡之路。

definition: see 邪道[xie2 dao4]
to diverge from the main road, also figuratively
fork in a road/wrong road
broad and open road (idiom); fig. brilliant future prospects
dishonest practices
(lit.) the road through Yangguan 陽關|阳关[Yang2 guan1]/(fig.) wide open road/bright future
lit. devil's gate, crooked path (idiom); corrupt practices/crooked methods/dishonesty
winding road/roundabout route/detour/(fig.) wrong way (of doing sth)
the correct path/the right way (Buddhism)
to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
method/way/approach
shortcut
to return to the right path/to mend one's ways/to reform/Reformed (church etc)
the road back to where one came from
to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
to mislead/to confuse/error/misconception/erroneous
